exceptions.label: Body-width crossover reversal
exceptions.what_happens: H-stripes WIDEN bodies above W:H ~0.52 (Ashida reversal). Effect is body-shape dependent.

exceptions.label: Stripe-count saturation / Oppel-Kundt peak
exceptions.what_happens: Peak at 8-12 fillers then DECLINES (Wackermann non-monotonic). Too many stripes = diminishing returns then reversal.

exceptions.label: Stripe contrast dependence
exceptions.what_happens: Low contrast stripes (<2:1 ratio) produce minimal effect. Effect requires visible stripe differentiation.

exceptions.label: Diagonal decomposition
exceptions.what_happens: Diagonal stripes decompose into H and V components. 45deg = half Helmholtz, half HVI elongation.

exceptions.label: Stripe width interaction unstudied
exceptions.what_happens: Stripe WIDTH is confounded with duty cycle. No controlled study varies stripe width on clothing.

exceptions.label: Garment fit × stripe interaction
exceptions.what_happens: Loose garment means illusion operates on GARMENT silhouette not body. Effect changes.

exceptions.label: 3D fabric drape destroys flat Helmholtz
exceptions.what_happens: On 3D draped fabric, H-stripes curve around body creating Goering illusion that may EMPHASIZE roundness. Worse on larger bodies, lightweight/stretch fabrics.

exceptions.label: Cognitive override (cultural belief)
exceptions.what_happens: In real-world social viewing, cultural belief 'stripes=fat' dominates memory-based judgment (Swami d=0.63). +0.5-1.0% cognitive widening term.

exceptions.label: Near-zero effect on white backgrounds
exceptions.what_happens: On white e-commerce backgrounds: only -0.19% width change (d=0.21, NS). Effectively zero.
exceptions.who_affected: EVERY user on standard white-background e-commerce

exceptions.label: Luminance saturation below L*~25
exceptions.what_happens: Below L*~25, going darker adds almost zero additional slimming. Diminishing returns asymptote.

exceptions.label: Fabric sheen overrides luminance
exceptions.what_happens: Shiny/satin dark fabrics create specular highlights (L*>60 locally) that outline body curvature. Shiny black may appear WIDER than matte black.
exceptions.score_impact: matte=1.0x, satin=0.4x, patent=0.15x of full luminance effect

exceptions.label: Grey-green anomaly
exceptions.what_happens: Grey (L*~50) perceived WIDER than white (L*~90+). Green perceived wider than similar-luminance colors. Red slimmer than its luminance predicts.
exceptions.score_impact: Luminance function underestimates widening for grey/green by 2-3%

exceptions.label: Skin-tone × garment color interaction
exceptions.what_happens: High contrast (deltaL>60, black on fair skin) may sharpen boundary (+0.5-1.5%). Low contrast (dark on dark skin) blends boundary.

exceptions.label: Entire principle is depth effect, not size
exceptions.what_happens: Advancing/receding is chromatic aberration + M/P system = DEPTH not WIDTH. Width contribution: 0.00.

exceptions.label: GR effect is aesthetic not perceptual-size
exceptions.rule_says: Golden ratio proportions create ideal proportions
exceptions.what_happens: GR rated 6.71 vs equal division 6.45 (0.26 points on 10-pt scale = 2.6%). Width: ±0.00.

exceptions.label: Cultural variation invalidates universal target
exceptions.what_happens: Beauty standards for body proportion vary by culture. WHR preferences range from 0.60 to 0.80+ across cultures.
exceptions.score_impact: Target ratio may need to shift ±0.03-0.05 for different cultures

exceptions.label: Short stature changes optimal break point
exceptions.rule_says: Place waist break at 38.2% from top
exceptions.what_happens: For <160cm bodies, 38.2% break is near actual waist, providing no corrective illusion.

exceptions.label: Multiple break points destroy single-ratio framework
exceptions.what_happens: Layered outfits create 3+ break points; no single break can be at GR. Must redirect to vertical continuity.

exceptions.label: Seated/cropped viewing eliminates proportion
exceptions.what_happens: Video calls, seated interaction: only upper body visible. Full-body proportion irrelevant.

exceptions.label: Busy all-over prints = no redirection
exceptions.what_happens: Equally complex pattern everywhere provides zero directional guidance. Viewer defaults to baseline (chest 28%, waist-hip 25%).

exceptions.label: Competing focal points cancel
exceptions.what_happens: Two equally strong focal points split attention; viewer oscillates. Functionally = no focal point.

exceptions.label: Focal point AT widest zone backfires
exceptions.what_happens: Bright belt/embellishment at widest zone INCREASES fixation by ~15-25% -> +6-10% perceived width.

exceptions.label: Moving viewer vs static image
exceptions.rule_says: Lab gaze patterns apply to real-world
exceptions.what_happens: Real-life involves movement, varying distances. Motion changes gaze patterns (drawn to MOVEMENT not visual weight).

exceptions.label: Frame effect destroys HVI
exceptions.what_happens: Vertical lines WITHIN horizontal frame (shirt hem + neckline) -> HVI reduced from 5-10% to ~1%. Most garments have horizontal borders.

exceptions.label: Too many vertical lines -> Oppel-Kundt widening
exceptions.what_happens: 8-12+ vertical elements trigger Oppel-Kundt expansion. V-stripes on cylinders look wider than plain (Thompson Exp 3).

exceptions.label: Vertical lines on draped fabric become curved
exceptions.what_happens: On 3D draped fabric, vertical seams curve around body. Curved lines don't produce HVI and may emphasize body convexity.

exceptions.label: High-contrast vertical lines -> irradiation expansion
exceptions.what_happens: Bright lines (L*>70) on dark ground: irradiation expands line width ~5-10%. 4 seams x 1cm = +2% width. Partially cancels elongation.

exceptions.label: Monochromatic column fails with texture discontinuities
exceptions.what_happens: Different fabric textures, visible seams, color mismatches reduce continuity. Reduces effect to 30-50% of single-piece.

exceptions.label: Deep V on wide chest -> horizontal width exposure
exceptions.what_happens: Deep V below sternum on wide chest: exposed skin creates horizontal extent. V-elongation offset by visible width.
exceptions.threshold: Exposed skin width >30% body width: elongation cancelled. >40%: net widening

exceptions.label: Shallow V (>80 degree) = no effect
exceptions.what_happens: At >80 degree total angle, V approaches crew/scoop. ML drops to near zero at 90 degree fin angle.

exceptions.label: V-neckline gap reversal on loose garments
exceptions.what_happens: If V doesn't contact body (8-18mm gap on loose garment), assimilation-to-contrast shift REVERSES ML.

exceptions.label: V on high contrast -> attention arrow to chest
exceptions.what_happens: Dark garment + light skin V = high-contrast triangle pointing down into chest. Increases chest fixation ~10-15%.

exceptions.label: Loose fit WIDENS small bodies
exceptions.what_happens: Slims UK16+ (-5-8%). No effect UK8-12. WIDENS UK6-8 (+2-4%) because garment silhouette > body width.

exceptions.label: Loose fit kills ALL perceptual illusions
exceptions.what_happens: All illusions need visible body contour. Loose garment means illusions on GARMENT not BODY. fit_modifier 0.3-0.6 on all P1-P6.

exceptions.label: Structured vs soft fabric -> different fit effects
exceptions.what_happens: Structured loose (blazer) creates engineered shape. Soft loose (jersey) partially reveals body. Different perceptual outcomes at same ease.

exceptions.label: Stretch fabric compression artifacts
exceptions.what_happens: Elastic fabric under tension: compression -2-5% actual width but strain lines create Oppel-Kundt +1-3%. Muffin-top at edges draws attention.

exceptions.label: Entire principle is unquantified
exceptions.rule_says: Small patterns on small, large on large
exceptions.what_happens: No peer-reviewed study quantifies the interaction. Direction is unknown.

exceptions.label: Very small patterns become texture
exceptions.what_happens: Below ~2mm repeat at viewing distance: pattern = texture. Adds visual weight without directional illusions.

exceptions.label: Entire monochromatic elongation effect is unquantified
exceptions.what_happens: No direct measurement. Estimated -0.02 to -0.05 from HVI chain.

exceptions.label: Color matching across garments is imperfect
exceptions.what_happens: Different fabrics, dye depths, visible seams reduce continuity to 30-50% of single piece.

exceptions.label: Monochromatic in LIGHT colors may widen
exceptions.what_happens: White column: HVI elongation (-2-5%) competes with full-body irradiation widening (+1-3%). On dark backgrounds, irradiation may DOMINATE.

exceptions.label: 2D lab data -> 3D real world conversion unknown
exceptions.what_happens: Thompson found 2x amplification (5.8% -> 10.7%) for ONE comparison. All other principles have unknown 2D->3D factors.

exceptions.label: Static viewing -> dynamic encounters
exceptions.what_happens: Lab uses static images. Real-life involves movement, social interaction, changing distance. Swami reversal suggests dynamic viewing fundamentally changes perception.

exceptions.label: Multi-garment outfits -> undefined interactions
exceptions.what_happens: Model scores single garments. Real outfits have 3-5 visible garments with untested interactions. 8 of 16 pairwise parameter interactions untested.

exceptions.label: Individual variability dwarfs single-cue effects
exceptions.what_happens: SD/Mean ~0.40-0.70. Effects <2% total fall within noise. Only multi-cue combinations >2% can be confidently recommended.

exceptions.name: V-Neck Elongation Reversal on Large Bust
exceptions.standard_rule: V-neck elongates the neck and torso
exceptions.exception: On DD+ busts, V-neck elongation plateaus then REVERSES into a 'dividing effect' where the V bisects the bust area, making bust the dominant focal point and eliminating neck elongation

stretch_examples: DD bust + 10% stretch: +0.28 inch effective deepening
G cup + 15% stretch: +0.60 inch effective deepening

exceptions.mechanism: At shallow-to-medium depths, V creates two diagonal lines converging downward — eye follows lines and reads 'elongation.' As V deepens, exposed skin triangle grows large enough to become its own visual AREA rather than a directional LINE. On large busts, bust projection causes fabric to separate at wider angle at bust apex, making triangle wider and more area-like at shallower depth. Eye transitions from reading 'elongating arrow' to reading 'bust display window.'
exceptions.detection: Body scan provides bust_differential. Product image analysis provides V-depth and fabric stretch estimate. Compute effective V-depth and compare to bust-size-specific threshold.
exceptions.frequency: Affects approximately 30% of women (DD+ cup size). Among DD+ women wearing V-necks, dividing effect active in ~60% of medium-V garments with stretch fabric.

exceptions.name: Boat Neck on Narrow Shoulders + Short Neck (Competing Effects)
exceptions.standard_rule: Boat neck is the best neckline for narrow shoulders
exceptions.exception: When user has BOTH narrow shoulders AND short neck, boat neck shoulder-widening benefit (+0.65) conflicts with severe neck-shortening penalty (-0.55). Rule holds for shoulder dimension but fails for overall flattery.

trigger.resolution_logic: If neck_deficit > shoulder_deficit * 0.5: neck penalty dominates (AVOID). Otherwise: shoulder benefit dominates (CONDITIONAL).

exceptions.mechanism: Boat neck creates strongest horizontal line of any neckline. Horizontal lines simultaneously widen shoulders (positive for narrow) and shorten neck (negative for short). These are mechanistically LINKED — cannot get one without the other. Physics constraint, not design choice.
exceptions.frequency: Approximately 8-12% of women have both narrow shoulders and short necks. For this population, boat neck produces suboptimal result in ~60% of cases.

exceptions.name: Crew Neck That Elongates (The Loose Crew Paradox)
exceptions.standard_rule: Crew neck shortens the neck
exceptions.exception: A loose crew neck (2"+ ease at neckline opening) drops below collarbone, creating a shallow scoop effect that MILDLY ELONGATES rather than shortens.

trigger.example: 3" ease crew in heavy fabric: (3 * 0.3) + 0.8 = 1.7" drop below collarbone

exceptions.mechanism: Rule assumes neckline sits AT base of neck. When neckline opening larger than head requires, gravity pulls circular opening downward. Neckline designed for neck base instead sits at/below collarbone, exposing neck that fitted crew would cover. Effect is a shallow scoop with rounded bottom edge.
exceptions.detection: Product image analysis estimates neckline ease from how fabric falls relative to model's collarbone position. 'Relaxed fit' or 'oversized' product tags correlate with loose crews.
exceptions.frequency: Approximately 35-40% of crew neck tops in fast fashion are relaxed/loose fit. Rule is partially or fully inverted for significant fraction of market.

exceptions.name: Wrap Dress Failures (Four Distinct Failure Modes)
exceptions.standard_rule: The wrap dress is universally flattering
exceptions.exception: Four independent failure modes each with different triggers

sub_modes.name: Large Bust Gaping
sub_modes.key_insight: Wrap dress is 'universally flattering' only when closure mechanism matches bust size. Silk wrap with tie-only fails for DD+. SAME dress with internal snap works fine. This is a GARMENT CONSTRUCTION detail, not a body type problem.

sub_modes.name: Small Bust Bunching
sub_modes.mechanism: Wrap panels designed to cross over bust, using bust projection as anchor point that holds fabric in position and creates diagonal drape. When bust too flat, panels have no anchor. They bunch, fold, collapse toward center without outward projection to maintain tension. Result: crumpled mass of fabric at chest reading as 'poor fit'.
sub_modes.perceived_effect: Shapeless volume rather than bust illusion

sub_modes.name: Thick Waist Tie Penalty

trigger.example: 2" wide tie with 4 fabric layers: 2 * 4 * 0.15 = 1.2" added circumference

sub_modes.mechanism: On well-defined waists (WHR < 0.75), tie's added bulk is negligible relative to 6-10" waist-hip differential. On thick waists (WHR > 0.85), tie's bulk is significant relative to 2-4" differential. Tie WIDENS rather than DEFINES.

sub_modes.name: Very Slim Frame Excess Fabric

trigger.condition: Size 0-2 or body width < 13" at bust

sub_modes.score_impact: Wrap score drops from +0.50 to approximately +0.05 (negligible benefit)
sub_modes.mechanism: Wrap engineered for bodies with CONTOURS to drape over. On very slim, flat frames, fabric has nowhere to go.
sub_modes.frequency: Approximately 5-8% of women in US market

exceptions.name: Turtleneck Triple Failure
exceptions.standard_rule: Turtleneck is a wardrobe staple
exceptions.exception: When short neck + round face + large bust co-occur, turtleneck scores negative on THREE dimensions simultaneously, creating compound catastrophe that no single score captures.

dimension_3.reason: Unbroken fabric mass from collar to bust creates monolithic block

compound_effect.reason: The gestalt effect is WORSE than sum of individual failures because eye processes entire upper body as single unflattering unit rather than processing each dimension independently

exceptions.gestalt_description: Entire upper body reads as wide, round, monolithic column topped by round face. No element provides visual relief. Turtleneck eliminates every natural break point (neckline, collarbone, decolletage) that would normally create visual interest and break up the mass.
exceptions.recommended_alternative: V-neck medium: +0.60 neck, +0.55 face, +0.15 bust minimization
exceptions.frequency: Full triple failure (short neck + round face + DD+ bust): approximately 4-6% of women. Double failure (any two of three): approximately 15-20%.
exceptions.unique_severity: No other neckline scores negative on ALL THREE dimensions. Most necklines fail on one dimension at most. Turtleneck's unique failure: SINGLE MECHANISM (covering neck with cylinder) creates cascading effects across multiple perceptual dimensions simultaneously.

exceptions.name: Square Neckline Geometry Loss in Drapey Fabric
exceptions.standard_rule: Square neckline angularizes round faces
exceptions.exception: Angularization effect entirely dependent on GEOMETRIC PRECISION of 90-degree corners. When fabric drapes, corners round off and 'square' becomes a wide scoop.

trigger.reclassification: Reclassify as scoop_wide when geometry lost

exceptions.detection: Engine must detect from product images rather than relying on product descriptions.
exceptions.frequency: Approximately 45-55% of 'square neck' garments in market use fabrics with drape coefficients above 0.5 without structural support. These are LABELED square neck but FUNCTION as scoops.

exceptions.name: Below-Knee Zone Collapse on Petite Bodies
exceptions.standard_rule: Below-knee is universally flattering
exceptions.exception: On bodies where knee-to-widest-calf distance < 5 inches, the 'safe zone' between knee danger zone and calf danger zone shrinks to 1 inch or less, making precise placement critical or impossible.

trigger.knee_lower: H_knee - 1.5 (lower boundary of knee danger zone)

exceptions.muscular_calf_exception: A 5'6" woman with muscular calves (prominence ratio > 1.4) has expanded calf danger zone (radius 2.25" instead of 1.5") which can collapse safe zone even at average height. Example: 5'6" with muscular calves: safe_zone = (20 - 1.5) - (15 + 2.25) = 1.25" — MARGINAL despite being 5'6".
exceptions.recommendation: SKIP below-knee if zone collapsed. Use above-knee or midi instead.
exceptions.frequency: Affects approximately 25-30% of women (those under 5'4" or with prominent calves at any height).

exceptions.name: Maxi/Floor-Length on Petite Frames
exceptions.standard_rule: Floor-length creates an elegant vertical line
exceptions.exception: On petite frames, garment-to-body ratio becomes extreme. Garment dominates visual and person appears 'swallowed' by fabric.
mitigation: Add heel height to reach threshold
Choose slim/column silhouette over full skirt
Ensure strong waist definition (belt, seam, or contrast)

exceptions.name: Ankle-Length Hemline + Heels (Disappearing Break)
exceptions.standard_rule: Ankle-length hemline is elongating because it frames the narrowest point
exceptions.exception: When wearing heels, shoe opening rises above ankle. Ankle-length garment designed for bare feet now falls ONTO the shoe rather than above it. The 'ankle break' (1-2" sliver of exposed ankle) disappears.

trigger.shoe_top: ankle_height + heel_height + 0.5 (shoe opening above ankle + heel + clearance)

break_disappeared.effect: Hem sits on shoe upper — creates bunching and 'too short for heels' look

minimal_break.effect: Only fractional ankle visible — reads as 'almost floor-length' rather than intentional ankle-length

score_impact.fix: Hem needs to be at least shoe_top + 1.5 inches from floor for proper ankle break with heels

exceptions.name: Midi Hemline Hits Widest Calf on Average Height
exceptions.standard_rule: Midi hemline is sophisticated
exceptions.exception: 'Midi' is a garment LENGTH description, not a body POSITION description. A garment labeled 'midi' on a 5'9" model can hit an entirely different anatomical position on a different-height user. Worst case: hemline exactly at widest calf.
fix_options: Shorten hem to clear above danger zone
Lengthen hem to clear below danger zone
exceptions.core_use_case: THE core Kridha use case. The user question from demo pitch: 'Will this midi dress actually look like a mid-length dress on me, or will it end up at my widest calf?' Answer depends on where it ACTUALLY falls relative to anatomy.

exceptions.name: Cap Sleeve That Works (The Flutter Exception)
exceptions.standard_rule: Cap sleeves make arms look wider
exceptions.exception: Flutter cap sleeves (loose, unstructured fabric at cap position) avoid worst aspects of standard cap sleeves despite terminating at same position.

standard_cap_failure: Hard horizontal hemline at widest arm point → creates precise width marker
Tight fit (negative ease) → compression → visual strain → perceived excess width
Static presentation → eye has time to register exact width
flutter_avoids_all_three: Soft, irregular edge → no precise width marker
Loose ease (+2-4") → no compression → no strain
Movement → eye processes motion rather than static width

quantified_difference.delta: 0.60 points — MASSIVE difference from same termination position

sub_failures.reason: Over-wide flutter adds significant visual mass to shoulder zone
Very full arms: flutter helps but can't fully overcome width peak
Sheer flutter reveals arm contour through fabric, defeating soft-edge benefit

exceptions.name: 3/4 Sleeve Length Miscalculation on Non-Average Arms
exceptions.standard_rule: 3/4 sleeve ends at the forearm's narrowest point
exceptions.exception: '3/4 sleeve' defined as PROPORTION of arm length. On petite women with shorter arms, standard 3/4 sleeve may end at WRIST rather than forearm narrowest. On tall women with long arms, same garment may end at mid-forearm (above narrowest point).
exceptions.critical_insight: The 'universally flattering' rule is based on the POSITION sleeve terminates, not the PROPORTION of arm it covers. On non-average arm lengths, proportion and position diverge. Engine must compute ACTUAL termination position from garment length + user arm length, not assume '3/4 sleeve' means 'at forearm narrowest.'

exceptions.name: Puff Sleeve Backfires (Four Independent Failure Modes)
exceptions.standard_rule: Puff sleeves balance narrow shoulders

sub_modes.name: Petite Frame Scale Violation
sub_modes.mechanism: Puff's volume occupies larger PROPORTION of small frame. 3" puff on 5'2" (62"): puff is 4.8% of total height vs 4.4% on 5'8" (68"). Eye processes 'that shoulder structure is ___% of this person's size.' On smaller frame, same puff reads as proportionally larger.
sub_modes.example: At 5'0": -0.32. Original narrow-shoulder score +0.80 → Adjusted +0.48. Still positive but marginal. Visual quality changes from 'elegantly proportioned' to 'costume-like.'

sub_modes.name: Short Neck Compression
sub_modes.mechanism: Puff sleeves raise visual 'shoulder platform' by 1-2 inches. Effectively SHORTENS neck by compressing chin-to-shoulder distance.
sub_modes.conflict: When user has narrow shoulders (puff helps: +0.80) AND short neck (puff hurts: -0.40): net depends on priority weighting, identical to boat neck conflict (N-02).

sub_modes.name: Large Bust Volume Compound
sub_modes.mechanism: Puff + bust = extreme upper body volume. Puff adds width at shoulder while bust adds depth at chest. Combined, upper body reads as single massive block.
sub_modes.visual_effect: Overall visual is 'broad AND heavy' rather than 'balanced.'

sub_modes.name: Wide Shoulders + Puff (Goal Mismatch)
sub_modes.mechanism: Not a 'failure' of the puff — puff works as designed (adds width). But on already-wide shoulders, MORE width is OPPOSITE of what's needed.
sub_modes.note: This is a GOAL MISMATCH, not a mechanism failure. Engine must detect this and NOT recommend puff sleeves even though 'puff provides shoulder widening' is mechanistically true.

exceptions.name: Empire Waist Tent Effect
exceptions.standard_rule: Empire waist elongates legs
exceptions.exception: On DD+ busts with stiff, non-stretchy fabric and no gathering below seam, empire line triggers 'tent effect' where fabric drops from bust apex at angle, creating triangle of air between fabric and body.

gathering_below_empire.mechanism: Breaks flat fall line, allows fabric to follow body contour

ruching_at_empire.mechanism: Textured surface at seam allows directional change

stretchy_fabric_per_pct.mechanism: Elasticity pulls fabric back toward body after bust apex

lightweight_fluid_fabric.mechanism: Gravity and drape pull fabric inward

empire_to_waist_tie.mechanism: Physically cinches fabric at point below bust

a_line_cut_below_empire.mechanism: Intentional flare means 'tent' is the design, not a flaw

trigger.example: DD bust with 3" projection in stiff fabric: 3 * 0.6 * 0.8 = 1.44" standoff → 2.88" added perceived waist circumference

exceptions.critical_distinction: An A-line dress with empire waist is DESIGNED to have fabric stand away from body. This is NOT a 'tent effect' — it's intentional silhouette. Tent effect is FAILURE that occurs when garment designed to follow body contour (fitted or skimming) but physically cannot due to bust projection + fabric stiffness.

exceptions.name: Bodycon on Non-Smooth Contours
exceptions.standard_rule: Bodycon shows off curves
exceptions.exception: Bodycon reveals EVERY contour, including contours user may not want revealed. Rule assumes smooth, convex contours. Real bodies have concavities (hip dips), ridges (bra lines), and folds (midsection skin folds) that bodycon maps precisely.

contour_specific_failures.fix: Smoothing undergarment OR switch to skimming fit (1-2" ease)
A-line or fit-and-flare silhouette bridges concavity with fabric
Smoothing bra OR garment with structured back panel
SIZE UP. Strain lines indicate garment is too small. Correct fit eliminates strain while maintaining bodycon silhouette.

exceptions.key_insight: Bodycon failure is NOT about body type — it's about SURFACE TEXTURE. Two women with identical measurements can have completely different bodycon outcomes if one has smooth contours and other has visible ridges/folds/dips. Body scan with only CIRCUMFERENCES misses this. Needs CONTOUR MAPPING (surface topology).

exceptions.name: A-Line Amplifies Wide Hips (Flare Origin Point)
exceptions.standard_rule: A-line flatters by skimming over hips
exceptions.exception: Effect depends critically on WHERE flare begins relative to widest hip point.

flare_positions.explanation: Flare extends beyond hip width, making hips appear relatively narrower WITHIN garment. Garment's outer edge, not hip, is widest point.
flare_positions.score_wide_hips: +0.25 (positive — wider frame makes hips relatively narrower)

flare_positions.explanation: Flare begins close to hip, fabric clings at widest point then flares. Transition from cling to flare EMPHASIZES hip as widest body point.
flare_positions.score_narrow_hips: +0.20 (mild positive — adds small amount of hip width)

flare_positions.explanation: Hip is fully defined by fitted fabric. Flare below adds volume to lower silhouette.
flare_positions.score_wide_hips: -0.35 (negative — hip fully revealed, flare below amplifies width)

exceptions.name: Dark Colors Not Always Slimming (Shape Loss Paradox)
exceptions.standard_rule: Dark colors are slimming
exceptions.exception: Head-to-toe monochrome dark eliminates ALL shape definition, making body read as featureless block that defaults to width of widest point.

trigger.all_dark: all L* values < 25 across multiple garment pieces

hourglass_WHR_below_0.75.explanation: All-dark eliminates contrast that would showcase waist-hip differential. Hourglass visually 'flattened' into dark column. Body reads as width of widest point throughout.
hourglass_WHR_below_0.75.fix: Break monochrome with lighter/contrasting element at waist. Belt, different-shade top, or textured middle creates needed contrast.

rectangle_apple_WHR_above_0.85.explanation: Minimal waist-hip differential means dark monochrome's 'column' effect is DESIRABLE — hides lack of waist definition that would be visible in contrasting colors.

exceptions.the_paradox: Dark monochrome is MORE flattering on bodies with LESS definition (rectangles, apples) and LESS flattering on bodies with MORE definition (hourglasses). Standard rule is backwards for most curved body types.

exceptions.name: Fit-Skim Rule Fails for Rectangles
exceptions.standard_rule: Fit at your narrowest, skim over your widest
exceptions.exception: On rectangle body types (waist-hip ratio 0.80-0.90), 'narrowest' and 'widest' points barely different. Fitting at waist and skimming over hip means garment transitions from slightly fitted to slightly loose over 2-3" circumference difference — reads as 'poor fit' not 'flattering shape.'

trigger.condition: max_circ - min_circ < 4 inches (between bust, waist, hip)

alternative_strategies.reason: Clean, consistent fit respects body's actual proportions
Fit-and-flare or peplum creates waist-hip differential via garment
External cinch creates visible waist on otherwise straight torso
Clearly oversized reads as 'fashion choice' rather than 'poor fit'

exceptions.name: Muscular Bodies Break Multiple Rules
exceptions.standard_rule: Various: skim over widest, 3/4 sleeve slims, A-line hides hips
exceptions.exception: Athletic/muscular bodies create unique exceptions because widest points are MUSCLE not adipose tissue. Standard rules assume user WANTS to minimize or conceal widest points. Muscular bodies may want to SHOWCASE them.

showcase_overrides.override: FIT at widest arm point — muscular definition is a feature, not a flaw
showcase_overrides.reason: Defined deltoids and biceps are positively perceived when user wants to showcase them

showcase_overrides.override: Fitted through hips — developed glutes are a feature
showcase_overrides.reason: Athletic hip development is desired contour, not concealment target

showcase_overrides.standard_rule: Avoid boat neck on wide shoulders
showcase_overrides.reason: Developed deltoids and wide clavicle are athletic features user wants to highlight
Low body fat + muscle definition creates smooth, convex contours bodycon was designed for. 'Contour issues' (rolls, dips) penalizing bodycon on soft tissue are absent on toned bodies.

soften_overrides.override: Raglan sleeves and V-necks softly narrow muscular shoulders
soften_overrides.reason: User wants to de-emphasize athletic build. Standard narrowing rules apply with ELEVATED priority.

exceptions.meta_insight: TWO WOMEN WITH IDENTICAL MEASUREMENTS can have OPPOSITE optimal recommendations if one is muscular (wants to showcase) and other carries same circumference in adipose tissue (wants to minimize). Scoring engine MUST include user aspiration as first-class input, not afterthought.

exceptions.name: V-Neck + Off-Shoulder Shoulder Cancellation
exceptions.standard_rule: Each element scored independently
exceptions.exception: V-neck's elongation competes with off-shoulder's horizontal emphasis. Off-shoulder widening reduced by 40% when combined with V-neck.
exceptions.mechanism: V-neck creates downward vertical line that partially cancels the horizontal emphasis of the off-shoulder cut.

exceptions.name: Empire Waist + Mini + Petite Frame (Over-Elongation)
exceptions.standard_rule: Empire elongates legs; mini shows maximum leg
exceptions.exception: Empire shifts perceived waist UP by 3-4 inches. Mini shows maximum leg. On 5'0" frame: combination makes torso appear EXTREMELY short (perceived torso: 20" instead of 24"). Body reads as 'all legs, no torso.'

exceptions.name: Turtleneck + Wide Belt (Competing Waist Signals)
exceptions.standard_rule: Turtleneck creates column; belt defines waist
exceptions.exception: Column wants continuity; belt demands interruption. These CONFLICT.

long_torso.note: Belt works — breaks excessive column length

short_torso.note: Column already proportional; belt makes it feel truncated

exceptions.name: Puff Sleeve + Fit-and-Flare + Petite (Volume Overload)
exceptions.standard_rule: Puff sleeves and fit-and-flare are individually flattering
exceptions.exception: Puff adds upper body volume, fit-and-flare adds lower body volume. Combined on petite frame: BOTH ends have added volume. Body appears wider at both top AND bottom with narrow middle. Creates 'doll-like' proportion reading as costume rather than fashion.

score_impact.note: Still net positive but significantly reduced from sum of parts

exceptions.name: Ankle-Length + Oversized Top (Proportion Loss)
exceptions.standard_rule: Ankle-length elongates; oversized top provides relaxed silhouette
exceptions.exception: Ankle-length assumes eye can read body proportions through garment. Oversized top hides waist and adds mass. Combined: body reads as 'wide top hanging over slim ankles.' No waist visible, no bust contour, no proportional reference.

fix.method: Add waist definition (belt, front tuck) to oversized top

exception_pipeline.description: Every garment evaluation should run through exception pipeline AFTER computing base scores, BEFORE outputting final score.
check_order: NECKLINE: N-01 (V-neck dividing), N-02 (boat neck conflict), N-03 (loose crew), N-04 (wrap failures), N-05 (turtleneck triple), N-06 (square drape)
HEMLINE: H-01 (zone collapse), H-02 (maxi overwhelm), H-03 (ankle break), H-04 (midi collision)
SLEEVE: S-01 (flutter exception), S-02 (3/4 position), S-03 (puff backfires)
SILHOUETTE: SF-01 (empire tent), SF-02 (bodycon contour), SF-03 (A-line flare), SF-04 (dark shape loss), SF-05 (rectangle fit-skim), SF-06 (muscular override)
every_exception_includes: Detection method from body scan + product image

name: Dark + Shiny Inversion
what_actually_happens: Sheen overwhelms color. Volume ADDS despite black. Black MATTE on apple belly: -0.37 (WORKS). Black SHINY on apple belly: +0.15 (FAILS).

name: Vertical Stripes 3D Curvature Reversal
what_actually_happens: Stripes curve around body, revealing contours instead of elongating. Projection > 2.5": reversed.

name: Horizontal Stripes Help Cases
what_actually_happens: Horizontal at bust HELPS proportion balance. Breaks excessive height. Creates faux curves.

name: Hourglass Sizing Paradox
what_actually_happens: Creates 8-14" waist excess. No single size works.

name: Dark Colors Overweighting for Plus Size
rule_it_breaks: Dark colors for plus size (as primary advice)
what_actually_happens: Overweights color (5th in hierarchy) vs fit/fabric that matter 3-5x more.

name: Structure Worse Than Cling for Hourglass
what_actually_happens: Structure fills concave waist = erases hourglass. Moderate cling is BETTER.

name: Fluid Fabrics Guarantee Belly Cling
what_actually_happens: Fluid at apple belly = guaranteed belly cling. Moderate structure is better.

name: Heavy Fluid Elongation for Petite
who_it_hurts: Petite (reversal: it helps in long garments)
what_actually_happens: Heavy fluid in maxi creates fall lines that elongate. Elongation bonus -0.05 to -0.12.

name: Small Patterns Horizontal Direction for Petite
what_actually_happens: Rule correct for scale, but misses that horizontal is WORST direction for petite.

name: Solid Colors Only for Plus-Size
what_actually_happens: Patterns are fine if scaled proportionally. Blanket ban eliminates self-expression.

name: Hourglass Concave Waist Sheen Reversal
rule_it_breaks: Sheen adds volume at all zones
what_actually_happens: Sheen creates shadow at concave waist = volume REDUCING (-0.03 to -0.08)

name: Concave Zone Cling Override
rule_it_breaks: Normal cling calculation applies to all zones
what_actually_happens: Concave zones gap rather than cling. Returns score -0.10 with status concave_gap.

name: R1: Tent x Hourglass Reversal
mechanism: Tent destroys WHR asset. Visible WHR ~0.70 -> perceived ~0.90. Conceals the body's best feature.

name: R2: Tent x Petite Reversal
mechanism: Fabric-to-body ratio exceeds 50%. Person disappears inside garment. Scale overwhelms frame.

name: R3: Tent x Plus Reversal
mechanism: Maximum absolute size overestimate. Viewers fill garment volume with body. Largest bodies -> largest overestimate.

name: R4: Tent x INVT Reversal
mechanism: Fabric hangs from widest point (shoulders), creating lampshade silhouette that amplifies the proportion problem.

name: R5: Bodycon x Apple Reversal (Amplified Negative)
mechanism: Maps every midsection contour. Canonical worst case for contour mapping. EXCEPTION: athletic/muscular apple +0.20.

name: R6: Bodycon x Hourglass Reversal
mechanism: Contours being revealed ARE the asset. Reveals WHR, bust-waist-hip transitions. The body IS the design.

name: R7: Color Break x Hourglass Reversal
mechanism: Belt highlights narrow waist — the hourglass's primary visual asset. Benefit overwhelms leg-shortening cost.

name: R8: H-Stripe x INVT Upper Reversal
mechanism: Helmholtz technically thins shoulders, but visual attention drawn to upper body outweighs the optical effect.

name: Dark + Shiny Inversion
description: Dark + high sheen (SI > 0.5) = specular highlights on dark surround creates MAXIMUM contour visibility (-0.15 penalty). Triple interaction: dark color contracts overall width, but sheen creates bright markers at every body protrusion. Net effect depends on fabric.

name: Muffin-Top Gate
description: For apple and plus-size bodies with belly zone concern > 0.3, waistband construction DOMINATES the rise score. Wide elastic (>=5cm, >=8% stretch): +0.10 smooth containment. Narrow rigid (<3cm, <5% stretch): OVERRIDE to -0.25 regardless of rise height. Muffin-top effect is more visible than elongation benefit.

name: Drape Gate (A-Line Shelf Inversion)
description: A-line benefit conditional on fabric drape coefficient. DC < 40% (drapey): full benefit. DC 40-65%: reduced x0.7. DC > 65% (stiff): INVERTED to shelf effect — fabric stands away from body at hip, adding net width. For plus-size, shelf effect amplified x1.5.

name: Concealment Paradox
description: When user's goal is slimming but they choose tent silhouette: engine scores negative for slimming (-0.40) while acknowledging positive for concealment (+0.35). Dual-goal split lets user make informed choice rather than receiving misleading 'it will be flattering' advice.

name: Hourglass Belt Reversal
description: For hourglass bodies, belt's benefit (highlighting narrowest waist circumference) overwhelms leg-shortening cost. Score flips from -0.10 base to +0.20. Generic stylists tell hourglasses to 'avoid breaking the vertical line' when they should do the opposite.

name: Fabric Construction Gate (Bodycon)
description: Same silhouette label ('bodycon'), opposite outcomes based on fabric. Thin jersey (GSM < 200, no structure): -0.40 for plus-size. Structured scuba/shapewear (GSM >= 250, compression panels): -0.05. 0.35-point difference from single attribute. Athletic apple exception: bodycon flips from -0.40 to +0.20.

name: Cling Trap
description: Matte + low-cling = optimal. But matte + HIGH-cling (cling risk > 0.6): fabric adheres to body surface, mapping contours more aggressively than sheen does. Overrides matte benefit to -0.15 for plus-size, -0.12 for apple, -0.10 for pear. Conventional advice 'choose matte fabrics' backfires when fabric weight and drape ignored.

name: Cross-Garment V-Neck + High Rise Conflict
description: V-neck + high rise on petite with short torso = conflicting attention directions. V pulls eye DOWN, high waistband pulls UP, framing shortest body segment. Score: -0.05. Same V-neck with mid or low rise = +0.15 (harmonious).
trigger: torso_score <= -1.0 AND rise_cm > 26 AND neckline == v_neck

name: Petite Short Torso Rise Inversion
description: When petite with torso_score <= -1.0 AND rise > 26cm: rise score INVERTED to -0.30. High rise compresses already-short torso — legs look long but torso disappears.

name: Athletic Apple Bodycon Exception
description: Apple bodies normally score -0.40 in thin bodycon. EXCEPTION: if is_athletic = True, score flips to +0.20 (showcases toned physique). Requires body composition data.

name: Plus-Size Bodycon Jersey vs Scuba
description: Thin jersey bodycon on plus-size: -0.40 (second-skin effect, every contour mapped). Structured scuba/shapewear bodycon: -0.05 (sculpts rather than maps). 0.35-point difference from fabric construction alone.

name: Hourglass Moderate Sheen Benefit
description: For hourglass bodies, moderate sheen (SI 0.35-0.55) is actually POSITIVE (+0.05) because it enhances curve visibility. Standard matte zone benefit is reduced to x0.5 for hourglass.

name: Hourglass + Belly Concern Bodycon Offset
description: Even for hourglass (where bodycon reversal applies), belly concern > 0.5 reduces the bodycon score by -0.15 offset. Thin bodycon: +0.30 - 0.15 = +0.15. Structured: +0.35 - 0.15 = +0.20.

name: Pear + Narrow Waist Belt Positive
description: Pear body with narrow waist (WHR < 0.75) can benefit from a belt (+0.05) since it highlights a proportionally narrow waist. Pear with moderate waist gets standard -0.10 penalty.

name: Turtleneck on Petite Short-Torso + High Rise
description: Counter-intuitively, turtleneck on petite short-torso WITH high rise scores +0.10 because it keeps the eye UP (away from the compressed torso zone). This contrasts with V-neck + high rise which conflicts.

name: P1-A: Bright Monochrome on Plus Figures
description: Bright/high-saturation colors (L*>70 or chroma>40) ADVANCE toward viewer, increasing apparent width. On plus builds, width amplification (-0.3 to -0.8") can equal elongation benefit (+0.5 to +1.0"), netting near-zero.
modification: Column bonus x0.30 (bright warm) or x0.50 (bright cool)

name: P1-B: Texture Mismatch Breaks Column
description: Matched color but dramatically different texture (satin top + matte cotton bottom) triggers Gestalt similarity-based partial segmentation despite color match.
modification: Column effect reduced to 40-90% depending on texture contrast

name: P1-C: Metamerism Under Different Lighting
description: Two fabrics matched under daylight (DE<2) may differ by DE 5-15 under tungsten/warm LED lighting. Synthetic-to-natural fiber mismatch is worst.
detection: Cannot detect from product images; flag as advisory

name: P1-D: Extremely Petite Frames + Volume
description: At height < 58" with relaxed/oversized fit, monochromatic column reads as 'pillar/tube' — garment silhouette ratio (3.2:1) dominates over body ratio (4.5:1).

name: P2-A: V-Neck Exaggerates Long Torso
description: On torso_to_leg_ratio > 1.15 with depth > 5", V adds visual length to torso zone while subtracting from overall height perception.
rescue: Deep V + high-waist tuck reassigns elongated inches to torso-only zone. Net returns to +0.05 to +0.15".

name: P2-B: Vertical Stripes WIDEN on Plus Bodies
description: Ashida et al. (2013): Vertical stripes on wider bodies curve at hip and bust, creating implicit horizontal signals at widest points.

name: P2-C: Princess Seams on DD+ Bust
description: Princess seams curve outward at full bust, creating horizontal signals at bust level. Two princess seams = two horizontal curves at same height.

name: P2-D: Wide Stripe Spacing Creates Width
description: Oppel-Kundt illusion. When spacing > 2.5", eye tracks horizontally between stripes.

name: P3-A: High-Waist on Short Torso INVERSION
description: THE HIGHEST-VALUE INSIGHT. When torso_to_leg_ratio < 0.85, high-waist compresses visible torso to < 12-15% of body height, triggering 'compressed/wrong' perception. ~30% of petite women have short torsos.
bust_complication: Short-torso + C+ cup amplifies compression by 1.3x (bust occupies large fraction of already-short torso, leaving 2-3" visible between bust and waistband)

name: P3-B: Untucked Top Wastes High-Waist
description: Untucked top covering waistband eliminates all proportion benefit. Visual waist defaults to top's hem (usually at hip).

name: P3-C: Stiff/Thick Waistband Visual Bulk
description: Thick stiff waistband (> 2") acts as rigid horizontal band, partially offsetting elevation benefit through segmentation.

name: P5-A: Too-Tight Creates Horizontal Pull Lines
description: When garment is 1+ size too small, visible horizontal stretch lines at bust/hip/thigh act as horizontal visual elements.

name: P5-B: Column Dress on Curvy Figures
description: Straight column dress on waist-hip differential > 10" either gaps at waist or creates tension at widest points.

name: P6-A: 'Nude' Doesn't Match Non-Light Skin Tones
description: Most brands' 'nude' is L*=70-80. For skin L* < 55, 'nude' shoe has DE > 15-25 = CONTRASTING.
kridha_signature: Don't recommend 'nude shoes.' Recommend specific shoe colors matching USER's skin tone. Skin L*=35: espresso/chocolate (L*=40-50). Skin L*=55: caramel/toffee (L*=55-65).

name: P7: Over-Elongated Legs on Inverted Triangle
description: When leg_fraction > 0.65 on inverted triangle body, proportion penalty amplified by 1.3x (over-elongated legs worsen shoulder-hip visual imbalance).

name: S1-C: Gradient/Ombre Softens Color Break
description: Gradual color transition (ombre) over 3-6" of vertical space reads as surface depth, not segmentation boundary.

name: S1-D: Same Pattern Continues Across Break
description: Same print on both garments applies Gestalt continuity — two zones grouped as one patterned surface with interruption.

name: S1-E: Sheer Layer Blurs Boundary
description: Translucent overlay spanning top-bottom boundary softens the edge.

name: FM#1: High-Waist Tuck on Long Torso = NET POSITIVE
description: If rise >= 11" AND tucked AND ratio > 1.05: the break CREATES favorable proportion by visually shortening torso. Segmentation cost (-0.55 to -0.96") offset by proportion benefit (+0.70 to +1.50"), producing NET POSITIVE +0.15 to +0.37 score.

name: FM#2: Bottom Matches Skin Tone
description: If bottom DE from skin < 5, break is softened because bottom 'disappears' into leg line.

name: FM#3: Midi on Tall + Slim Calves
description: At 5'7"+ with calf_ankle_ratio < 1.4: visible shin is 12-16" (18-24% body height, above 15% threshold). Width differential < 1.5" circumference.

name: FM#4: Asymmetric Hem
description: Diagonal hemline creates Kunnapas diagonal overestimation (+0.3 to +0.6"). Use HIGHER point as effective hemline.

name: S2-D: Full/Circle Skirt Midi
description: Full skirt creates diagonal lines from waist to hem. Dynamic movement reduces static 'horizontal at mid-calf' signal.

name: S2-E: High-Low Hem
description: Front hemline determines primary visual impression (~70% of viewing is from front). Use front hemline as primary scoring position, back weighted 20-30%.

name: FM#13: Midi + Color-Matched Boots
description: When boot meets hem AND DE(boot, skirt) < 5, visual system processes boot + skirt as one continuous column.

name: FM#5: T-Strap Paradox
description: T-strap's vertical element (3-4" from toe to ankle) triggers vertical overestimation, partially offsetting horizontal crossing.

name: FM#6: Strappy Sandal Multi-Strap
description: Multiple thin straps (< 0.15" each, 3+ straps) register as 'shoe texture' rather than discrete horizontal boundaries.

name: S3-C: Platform Ankle Strap NET POSITIVE
description: Platform physical height gain overwhelms strap penalty. 3" platform + matching strap = net +1.75 to +2.35".

name: S3-D: Gladiator Sandals
description: Vertical connecting straps partially offset horizontal segmentation. Gladiator extending to mid-calf + skin-matching: 30-45% of penalty.

name: FM#7: Low-Rise on Short Torso
description: On ratio < 0.85, low-rise extends visible torso toward golden ratio. Depression penalty (-0.27 to -0.45") may be LESS damaging than high-rise compression (-0.40 to -0.55") on this body type.

name: FM#8: Drop-Waist on Very Tall
description: At 5'9"+ with drop < 2", ratio shift is only 3 percentage points at this leg length — ~3x less salient than same shift at 5'2".

name: FM#9: Strategic Oversized Crop
description: Oversized crop top + slim high-waist bottom: width CONTRAST between wide upper and narrow lower causes lower zone estimated ~2-4% taller (Bennett & Warren 2013). Elongation +0.60 to +1.36" substantially offsets width penalty -0.40 to -1.30".

name: S5-C: Open Oversized Layer
description: Unbuttoned blazer/coat reveals fitted interior. Observer processes inner silhouette as 'body' and outer as 'context.'

retention.long_open_duster: 15-25% (vertical edges may provide net positive +0.05 to +0.15")

name: S5-D: Oversized + Vertical Stripes
description: Vertical lines counteract width. Pinstripes on oversized blazer.

name: S6-A: Cuff Matching Shoe Color
description: Cuff matching shoe color (DE < 5) + gap < 1" = cuff and shoe read as same zone.

name: FM#10: Tiny Gap + Nude Shoe = POSITIVE
description: Gap < 0.75" + nude shoe (DE < 3) = POSITIVE (+0.02 score). Shoe merges with skin, adding ~3-4" of visual leg.

name: FM#11: Thin Tonal Belt at High Waist = NET POSITIVE
description: Width < 0.75" AND DE < 3 AND above natural waist -> penalty ~-0.005 (effectively zero). Combined with Layer 2 proportion benefit: net +0.27 to +0.54".

name: FM#12: Color-Matched Boot + Opaque Tights
description: Color-matched boot + opaque tights (DE < 5): boot EXTENDS monochromatic column instead of interrupting it.

name: Contradiction #1: The Great Stripes War
description: Lab (static, controlled): Helmholtz says horizontal = taller (Thompson 2011). Ecological (real, dynamic): Popular wisdom says horizontal = wider (Swami 2012). Resolution: Both right in different contexts. Apply weak effect, never let stripes drive recommendations. Confidence: 35%.

name: Contradiction #2: High-Waist 'Always' Works
description: Popular advice: 'High-waist always elongates.' Reality: On short-torso bodies (ratio < 0.85), high-waist COMPRESSES. ~30% of petite women have short torsos. Resolution: Body-conditional scoring. Kridha's highest-value insight.

name: Contradiction #3: 'Nude' Shoes
description: Industry: 'Nude shoes elongate.' Reality: Only for light skin tones. For most non-white consumers, standard 'nude' creates CONTRAST. Resolution: Skin-tone-matched recommendation. Kridha's biggest personalization opportunity.

name: Contradiction #10: Lab-to-Real-World Transfer
description: All lab effects are overstated by 25-50% for real-world application. Resolution: Revised score-to-inches multiplier from 2.75 to 2.25. Uncertainty: +/-25%.

name: Contradiction #11: Stylists vs. Perceptual Science
description: Science measures: How tall does this person LOOK? Stylists optimize: How does this person FEEL / how confident do they look? Resolution: Scoring engine scores optics. Recommendation engine incorporates style. When optical score is mildly negative but style is high, present honestly with trade-off.

name: Contradictions 4-9 (Belt, Midi, Bodycon, Print, Monochrome Bright/Dark, Ankle Strap)
description: Contradictions 4-9 cover: belt effects, midi exceptions, bodycon vs. fitted, print placement vs. scale, monochromatic bright vs. dark, and ankle strap context dependency. Full details in source_disagreement_analysis.md.

name: Inverted Triangle V-Neck Wide Angle Override
description: Wide V (> 60 degrees) draws eye to widest zone (shoulders) on inverted triangle body.

name: Apple + Large Bust V-Neck Override
description: Deep V (> 6") on apple + DD+ draws eye to bust width.

trigger_condition: WHR > 0.92 AND garment has horizontal stripes
actual_effect: REVERSAL: H-stripes become measurement lines, actively widening by 0.12 points on slim axis
source_text: Ashida Stripe Reversal: Standard Rule 'H-stripes slim'. When It Breaks: WHR > 0.92. Corrected Action: PROHIBIT H-stripes; recommend solid dark. Impact: 0.12 points on slim axis.

trigger_condition: H < 63 inches AND flare angle > 35 degrees
actual_effect: Severe shortening: tall -0.12. Circle skirt PROHIBITED for petite.
source_text: Petite Circle Skirt: Standard Rule 'A-line is flattering'. When It Breaks: H < 63" AND flare > 35 degrees. Corrected Action: Cap angle at 20 degrees; structured fabric only. Impact: Tall -0.12 (severe shortening).

trigger_condition: Pear body type AND H < 67 inches AND outfit is color-blocked (dark bottom, light top)
expected_effect: Dark bottom / light top recommended for pear
actual_effect: Color-blocked creates horizontal break; dark MONOCHROME eliminates break. 0.15 swing (largest single recommendation change).
source_text: Pear Color-Block Trap: Standard Rule 'Dark bottom, light top for pear'. When It Breaks: H < 67" (most pears). Corrected Action: Dark MONOCHROME eliminates break. Impact: 0.15 swing (largest single recommendation change).

actual_effect: Belt draws bright horizontal line at widest zone. 0.08 on slim axis.
source_text: Apple Belt Danger: Standard Rule 'Belts define the waist'. When It Breaks: WHR > 0.85 + contrast > 0.30. Corrected Action: Beltless or narrow tone-on-tone. Impact: 0.08 on slim axis.

trigger_condition: WHR > 0.85 AND poor fit quality on high rise garment
actual_effect: Muffin top: 0.14 swing (+/-0.06 slim vs. +0.08 tall).
source_text: Apple Muffin Top: Standard Rule 'High rise elongates'. When It Breaks: WHR > 0.85 + poor fit. Corrected Action: Mid-rise (9-10") as safe default. Impact: 0.14 swing (+-0.06 slim vs. +0.08 tall).

trigger_condition: Plus size body AND hourglass sub-shape (WHR < 0.80) AND bodycon garment
actual_effect: Hourglass-plus GAINS +0.08 that blanket advice denies. Score by sub-shape, not size.
source_text: Plus Bodycon Split: Standard Rule 'No bodycon for plus'. When It Breaks: Hourglass-plus (WHR < 0.80). Corrected Action: Score by sub-shape, not size. Impact: Hourglass-plus gains +0.08 that blanket advice denies.

actual_effect: Sheen highlights at convexities; up to 80% of slim benefit lost.
source_text: Sheen on Dark: Standard Rule 'Black is always slimming'. When It Breaks: Fabric sheen > 0.50 (satin/patent). Corrected Action: Matte dark only; sheen highlights at convexities. Impact: Up to 80% of slim benefit lost.

actual_effect: Tall benefit nullified entirely. Torso compressed to visually tiny strip.
source_text: Torso Compression: Standard Rule 'High rise is always better'. When It Breaks: TLR < 0.52 + rise > 10.5". Corrected Action: Mid-rise preserves torso proportion. Impact: Tall benefit nullified entirely.

trigger_condition: H-stripes on hourglass body: optimal, score +0.06 slim. Same H-stripes on apple WHR > 0.92: reversal, score -0.06 slim.
expected_effect: H-stripes are universally good or bad
actual_effect: 0.12 point spread (60% of total meaningful range) between optimal and devastating for different body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: H-Stripes. OPTIMAL For Hourglass (slim +0.06). DEVASTATING For Apple WHR > 0.92 (slim -0.06). Score Spread: 0.12 points.

trigger_condition: Bodycon on hourglass: optimal +0.08. Same bodycon on apple: devastating -0.08.
expected_effect: Bodycon is universally good or bad
actual_effect: 0.16 point spread between body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: Bodycon. OPTIMAL For Hourglass (+0.08). DEVASTATING For Apple (-0.08). Score Spread: 0.16 points.

trigger_condition: A-line > 25 degrees on inverted triangle: optimal +0.14. Same A-line on petite: devastating tall -0.08.
actual_effect: 0.22 point spread between body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: A-Line > 25 degrees. OPTIMAL For Inverted Triangle (+0.14 with balance). DEVASTATING For Petite (tall -0.08 shortening). Score Spread: 0.22 points.

trigger_condition: Wide contrasting belt on hourglass: optimal +0.08. Same belt on apple: -0.04 AND petite: tall -0.11.
actual_effect: 0.12-0.19 point spread between body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: Belt (wide, contrasting). OPTIMAL For Hourglass (+0.08). DEVASTATING For Apple (-0.04) and Petite (tall -0.11). Score Spread: 0.12-0.19 points.

trigger_condition: Color-blocked dark bottom on tall body: no penalty. Same on pear under 5'7": -0.15 vs monochrome.
expected_effect: Color-blocking is a neutral styling choice
actual_effect: 0.15 point effective swing between body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: Color-blocked dark bottom. OPTIMAL For Tall (no penalty, adds interest). DEVASTATING For Pear under 5'7" (-0.15 vs. monochrome). Score Spread: 0.15 points effective swing.

trigger_condition: Turtleneck on inverted triangle: acceptable +0.02 slim. Same turtleneck on petite with short neck: -0.05 tall.
expected_effect: Turtleneck is a neutral neckline choice
actual_effect: 0.07 point spread between body types.
source_text: Critical Crossover: Turtleneck. OPTIMAL For Inverted Triangle (+0.02 slim). DEVASTATING For Petite with short neck (-0.05 tall). Score Spread: 0.07 points.

actual_effect: Rectangle gets 'featureless column' effect (shape -0.05). Only technique where generic advice is mostly right but still has an exception.
source_text: Dark monochrome: Near-universal positive. Rectangle gets 'featureless column' (shape -0.05). Only technique where generic advice is mostly right.

actual_effect: Specular highlights map 3D body contours, creating +2% widening instead of -5% slimming. OVERRIDES dark-color slimming.
source_text: EX-01: Shiny Fabric Reversal. Sheen > 0.7 on dark fabric: dark satin on curves = +2% widening instead of -5% slimming.

actual_effect: Skin-tight dark clothing reveals body contour instead of concealing it. Body-mapping, not slimming.
source_text: EX-02: Tight Fit Contour Exposure. Fit tightness > 0.8: dark compression leggings on larger bodies = body-mapping.

actual_effect: Structured garment holds silhouette independent of body shape. White structured blazer widens by +1.8% instead of +6%.
source_text: EX-03: Structured Light Reduces Widening. Rigidity > 0.7: widens +1.8% instead of +6%.

trigger_condition: High luminance contrast between dark skin and light/white fabric
actual_effect: Strong contour edge modifies width perception. Dark skin + white fabric: widening reduced 40%.
source_text: EX-06: Skin-Fabric Contrast. Dark skin + white fabric: widening reduced 40%.

actual_effect: Acts as advancing pink (widening), not slimming red. Dusty rose, salmon, coral = light-toned.
source_text: EX-07: Red Saturation Gate. Saturation < 0.4: pink, not red.

expected_effect: Horizontal stripes create Helmholtz slimming illusion
actual_effect: Insufficient repetition. Single stripe = emphasis band. Two stripes = frame. Three+ = illusion.
source_text: EX-09: Stripe Count Minimum. Fewer than 3 visible stripes: no Helmholtz.

trigger_condition: Stripes covering only one body zone (bust band, hip band, waist band)
actual_effect: Zone-localized stripes function as EMPHASIS markers, not Helmholtz. H-stripe only on hips of pear = +2-3% hip emphasis.
source_text: EX-13: Stripe Zone Localization. Single-zone stripes = emphasis, not illusion.

trigger_condition: Bust > 40 inches AND V-neck depth > 6 inches
actual_effect: Fabric pulls apart under bust weight, creating horizontal gap line. ΔSHR flips from -0.03 to +0.02.
source_text: EX-15: V-Neck Gaping. Bust>40" + depth>6": ΔSHR flips to +0.02.

trigger_condition: Visible neck length < 3 inches AND boat neckline
actual_effect: SHR delta still applies but horizontal line creates 'head directly on shoulders' compression. Aesthetic penalty -0.10.
source_text: EX-17: Boat Neck Short Neck. Neck < 3": 'no neck' compression. Aesthetic penalty -0.10.

trigger_condition: SHR < 0.85 AND peplum flare > 3 inches (extreme pear)
actual_effect: Large peplum at natural waist on extreme pear creates mushroom effect. Flare launches from WIDEST point. ΔWHR reverses to +0.02.
source_text: EX-25: Peplum on Extreme Pear. SHR<0.85 + flare>3": mushroom effect. Reverses to +0.02.

trigger_condition: Fabric rigidity > 0.7 on A-line skirt for pear (SHR < 0.88)
actual_effect: Stiff A-line tents from widest hip point instead of skimming. ΔSHR flips from -0.04 to +0.01.
source_text: EX-30: A-Line Stiff Fabric on Pear. Rigidity>0.7: tents from widest point. Flips to +0.01.

actual_effect: Belt draws bright horizontal line at widest zone, highlighting ABSENCE of waist indentation. ΔWHR reverses from -0.02 to +0.02.
source_text: EX-37: Belt on Undefined Waist. WHR>0.88 + contrast belt: reverses to +0.02.

trigger_condition: WHR > 0.90 AND bust > 38 inches AND standard wrap dress
actual_effect: Tie gathers fabric at widest zone, adding bulk. A-line flare from widest point = mushroom. ΔWHR reduced to -0.01.
source_text: EX-38: Wrap on Apple. WHR>0.90 + bust>38": reduced to -0.01.

trigger_condition: Bust > 42 inches AND standard wrap dress
actual_effect: V-neck gapes under bust weight, cross-body fabric strains creating horizontal tension lines. Alternative: faux wrap.
source_text: EX-39: Wrap + Large Bust. Bust>42": gaping + tension lines. Use faux wrap.

actual_effect: Torso compressed to visually tiny strip. ΔVR REVERSES from -0.06 to +0.03 (HARMFUL).
source_text: EX-45: High Waist on Short Torso. VR<0.40: reverses to +0.03.

actual_effect: Creates visible color break at ankle, WORSENING leg-line continuity vs deliberately contrasting shoe. ΔVR reverses to +0.01.
source_text: EX-47: Nude Shoe Mismatch. Δ>0.15: reverses to +0.01.

trigger_condition: Height < 63 inches AND ankle strap shoe
expected_effect: Ankle strap is neutral footwear choice
actual_effect: Horizontal line visually amputates leg at narrowest ankle point. ΔVR = +0.025 (harmful). Strong avoid.
source_text: EX-48: Ankle Strap on Petite. Height<63": leg amputation. ΔVR +0.025.

trigger_condition: Cropped jacket at one height + visible inner hem at different height
expected_effect: Cropped jacket creates clean waist break (ΔVR -0.03)
actual_effect: Two competing horizontal lines create visual confusion. Both breaks nullified.
source_text: EX-51: Competing Visual Breaks. Two hem heights cancel each other.

trigger_condition: 3+ techniques targeting same body zone (e.g., boat neck + puff sleeve + shoulder pad on pear)
expected_effect: Each technique adds its full effect
actual_effect: Diminishing returns: 3rd technique at 50% effectiveness, 4th at 20%.
source_text: EX-53: Zone Overload. 3+ techniques same zone: diminishing returns.

trigger_condition: |VR - 0.46| < 0.02 (balanced body) AND triple VR stacking (high-waist + tuck + matching shoe)
actual_effect: Already-balanced body pushed past optimal into comical proportions. Overcorrection.
source_text: EX-54: Overcorrection on Balanced Body. Triple stacking pushes past optimal.

expected_effect: Each technique adds proportional waist definition
actual_effect: Diminishing returns decay: 100%, 80%, 50%, 20%. Each additional contributes less.
source_text: EX-56: Diminishing Returns Stacking. Decay: 100%, 80%, 50%, 20%. ESTIMATED.

expected_effect: Full silhouette-modifying effect from garment construction
actual_effect: All effects scale linearly with opacity. At 50%, a -0.06 ΔSHR becomes -0.03.
source_text: EX-59: Sheer Opacity Scaling. Linear with opacity.

actual_effect: Clingy fabric maps body contour at midsection, exposing undefined waist regardless of garment construction.
source_text: EX-62: Cling on Undefined Waist. Cling>0.7 + WHR>0.85: contour exposure.

actual_effect: ASHIDA REVERSAL: stripes invert and attenuate, score *= -0.50. May ADD 1-3% width.
source_text: Exception 1A: Body-size reversal. BWR > 1.15: stripe_score *= -0.50. Ashida 2013.

actual_effect: Observer variability widens confidence interval: score x [0.60, 1.40].
source_text: Exception 1B: Observer variability. Always applies. Confidence interval: score x [0.60, 1.40]. Ashida 2013.

trigger_condition: Any striped garment in real-world (non-lab) context
actual_effect: 35% reduction from lab: score *= 0.65.
source_text: Exception 1C: Real-world attenuation. Score *= 0.65. Derived from Swami gap.

actual_effect: Thick stripes attenuate: >15mm x0.40, >30mm x0.15.
source_text: Exception 1D: Thick stripes. >15mm: x0.40. >30mm: x0.15. Thompson spatial frequency.

trigger_condition: Striped garment covering only part of body (e.g., striped top, solid bottom)
actual_effect: Score scales by garment_area / visible_body coverage fraction.
source_text: Exception 1E: Partial coverage. Score *= garment_area / visible_body.

actual_effect: Fabric clings to body contour: body reveals, not reshapes. Score *= 0.35.
source_text: Exception 1F: Fabric cling. Cling > 0.70, GSM < 100: score *= 0.35.

actual_effect: Shiny dark fabric: specular highlights map contour. Score *= (1.0 - sheen). At 0.80: essentially neutralized.
source_text: Exception 2A: Shiny dark fabric. Sheen > 0.50: score *= (1.0 - sheen).

trigger_condition: Dark skin + dark clothing (skin-garment contrast < 15 L*)
actual_effect: Low contrast reduces slimming to 30% effectiveness. Suggest navy/forest instead of black.
source_text: Exception 2B: Dark skin + dark clothing. Contrast < 15 L*: score *= 0.30.

trigger_condition: Dim ambient lighting vs harsh fluorescent
actual_effect: Dim lighting: +0.10 bonus. Fluorescent: -0.05 penalty.
source_text: Exception 2C: Environment lighting. Dim: +0.10; fluorescent: -0.05.

trigger_condition: All garments L* < 0.15 with no texture variation
actual_effect: Flat silhouette penalty: -0.10. No visual interest, body becomes shapeless mass.
source_text: Exception 2D: All-black mono-silhouette. Score -= 0.10 (flat silhouette penalty).

actual_effect: REVERSAL: over-elongation 'giraffe effect'. Score -0.08. Better: crew, boat, mock.
source_text: Long neck: V penalty -0.08 ('giraffe effect'). Better: crew, boat, mock.

actual_effect: Exposure dominates elongation. Eye stops at cleavage, not neckline geometry.
source_text: Large bust + deep V: exposure dominates. Better: moderate V (10-12cm) or scoop.

actual_effect: Deep V empties torso, reveals shortness. Not enough torso for elongation effect.
source_text: Petite short torso: deep V empties torso. Better: moderate V (8-10cm) or sweetheart.

expected_effect: V-neck provides mild narrowing (positive for most)
actual_effect: V narrows shoulders FURTHER (bad for already-narrow). REVERSAL: boat neck +0.30 WHERE NEEDED.
source_text: Narrow shoulders: V narrows further. REVERSAL: boat +0.30 widens where needed.

actual_effect: A-line doesn't touch calf: penalty x0.40 (circle skirt: x0.20). Reduced hemline impact.
source_text: A-line/flared hemlines don't touch calf: penalty x0.40 (circle skirt: x0.20).

expected_effect: Standard hemline scoring at fabric hem
actual_effect: Score = 0.7 x slit_peak + 0.3 x fabric_hem (weighted by visual exposure).
source_text: Slit dresses: score = 0.7 x slit_peak + 0.3 x fabric_hem.

actual_effect: Disable anatomical logic entirely; use cultural silhouette scoring instead.
source_text: Cultural garments: disable anatomical logic entirely; use cultural silhouette scoring.

trigger_condition: Tall + slim calves (>175cm, calf <34cm) at mid-calf hemline
actual_effect: Penalty halved (slim calves reduce V-H compound effect).
source_text: Tall + slim calves (>175cm, calf <34cm): penalty halved.

actual_effect: Boots move visual cut point; score the VISIBLE gap between boot top and hemline.
source_text: Boots: knee-high boots move the visual cut point; score the VISIBLE gap.

actual_effect: Torso disappears: -0.18 penalty. Natural waist +0.10 preferred.
source_text: Short torso (TLR < 0.92): empire -0.18. Natural waist +0.10.

trigger_condition: HRT use, active weightlifting, or favorable genetics in 50+ age range
actual_effect: 10-15 year variation. Athletic 55yo may have better tissue than sedentary 35yo. MUST NOT use age alone.
source_text: Exception 9A: HRT, active weightlifting, genetics create 10-15 year variation.

actual_effect: Suggest heavier fabric for cleaner armhole line. NEVER suggest longer sleeves.
source_text: Exception 9C: sleeveless + GSM<130 + tissue_compliance<0.70: suggest heavier fabric. NEVER longer sleeves.

actual_effect: Waistline sits at hip (delta=-8 to -12cm), scores 0.30 under standard rules. MUST bypass standard waistline scoring; use choli_length + skirt_flare_angle instead.
source_text: Lehenga: waistline at hip, bypass standard scoring. Use choli_length + skirt_flare_angle.

trigger_condition: User overrides a scoring category 5+ times
actual_effect: META-EXCEPTION: halve that category's weight. User preference override.
source_text: META-EXCEPTION: If user overrides a category 5+ times: halve that weight.

actual_effect: LEARNING LOOP: auto-update threshold with logging. At >5%: flag for review.
source_text: LEARNING LOOP: >5% divergence: flag for review. >15%: auto-update with logging.
